OSKAR RADON

ABOUTWORKCONTACT

MoSK

DESIGN · EMBER · SCSS · JAVASCRIPT

View the finished site

View the repository on GitHub

MoSK is an Ember app I designed and built with Molly Curtin as part of the Epicodus JavaScript course. We used a Firebase database with some example seed data in a JSON file. Users can add works to their cart, and add, delete, and update works. Some functionality that would be cool to add is the ability to have multiple users with authentication, and the ability to search the database. I implemented search functionality in Lousy Lifehacks, another Ember app I made at Epicodus as a group project with the YouTube API.

Iâ€™m proud of the project because the design is so clean and bright. If this were designed to have more works it would make sense to display the images smaller and contain all the information a bit more, maybe making the grid 4 or 5 across. As it is the white space balances the bright colors and opinionated font choice of the monospaced Inconsolata. I also really dig the fixed nav buttons on the left, and the logo with negative letter-spacing which is an homage of course to the MoMA. Using #FF0000 and #0000FF as the red and blue colors for this project was a bold choice, but in this case it adds to the playful and iconic nature of the design.

THANKS FOR WATCHING!
